title: Why do music montages dominate TV drama shows? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t know if they dominate, but this is a crappy phenomenon. I first noticed it on “ER” back in the day. They obviously were 2–3 minutes short, and something very sad had happened during the episode. So they play a sappy song over a montage shot of everyone’s going about his or her day, etc. Other shows picked up on this — hey, good writers are hard to find — and this is an easy way out. It’s lazy and adds nothing to the story.

Music montages are a cheap way of injecting drama into a scene or sequence. They tend to be overdone in most shows and movies. There are many shows which use them at the end of every single episode in order to emotionally wrap up the show. It’s a tried and true concept, and is often used when the show is struggling to have real drama — so they use fake drama in its place.
